hypothesis_content.title: Post-News Volatility Compression Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: Following a significant negative news catalyst (e.g., major exchange hack, regulatory crackdown headline) that causes a sharp, high-volume price drop (>3% within 2 hours), the subsequent 24-hour period will exhibit amplified directional momentum in the *opposite* direction of the initial spike as over-leveraged positions are cleared and the market reassesses the actual impact.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Sharp, news-driven sell-offs often force liquidations and trap late shorts. Once the emotional selling exhausts and the news is digested (often found to be less severe than initial headlines), a swift reversal occurs. The consolidation period filters for exhaustion before the reversal leg.
entry_conditions: BTC 2-hour candle closes >3% below previous close on volume >150% of 20-period average
Candle coincides with a surge in negative news sentiment score (external data feed) >2 standard deviations above mean
Wait for a 4-hour consolidation period where price remains within +/- 1.5% of the low
Enter LONG on a break above the high of this 4-hour consolidation range

exit_conditions.take_profit: 1.8x the amplitude of the initial news-driven drop (measured from entry to the pre-news swing high)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Below the low of the 4-hour consolidation range by 0.5%
exit_conditions.time_exit: 24 hours after entry if neither TP nor SL is hit

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 55% of such setups result in the continuation of the initial news-driven direction beyond the consolidation range, invalidating the reversal premise.
